document.docAuthor: Amorim, Saulo S., Norton, Roy A. & Oliveira, Anibal R.
document.docTitle: Neopilizetes triumnasus Amorim & Norton & Oliveira 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical mite genus Neopilizetes (Oribatida: Galumnidae): redescription of N. neotropicus, rediagnosis of the genus, and descriptions of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical mite genus Neopilizetes (Oribatida: Galumnidae): redescription of N. neotropicus, rediagnosis of the genus, and descriptions of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . ROSTRUM WITH SMALL, SMOOTH, SUbRECTANgULAR MEDIAL PROjECTION bETWEEN INSERTIONS Of ROSTRAL ( ro ) SETAE, TRILObED IN DORSAL VIEW AND bILObED IN fRONTAL VIEW; PRODORSUM AND NOTOgASTER COVERED WITH SHORT CRESTS; NOTOgASTER WITH INCONSPICUOUS LONgITUDINAL DEPRESSIONS: UNPAIRED CENTRAL ONE IN ANTERIOR HALf AND PAIRED DEPRESSIONS IN POSTERIOR REgION jUST MEDIAL TO SETAE h 1 AND p 1 , WITH APPARENT LOW MOUND bETWEEN THEM; POSTERIOR MARgIN fLAT; SUbCAPITULUM COVERED WITH LONgITUDINAL CRESTS. SETA 1c PRESENT.

Etymology. THE SPECIES NAME
triumnasus
ALLUDES TO THE MEDIAL PROjECTION bETWEEN INSERTIONS Of ROSTRAL SETAE WITH THREE TIPS , AS ObSERVED IN DORSAL VIEW .

Prodorsum. SCULPTURINg fORMED bY VERY SHORT CRESTS OR TUbERCLES COVERINg ENTIRE SURfACE. ROSTRUM fORMINg AN ELONgATED SMALL , SMOOTH , SUbRECTANgULAR MEDIAL PROjECTION bETWEEN INSERTIONS Of ro SETA , TRILObED IN DORSAL VIEW AND bILObED IN fRONTAL VIEW . SETAE ro , LAMELLAR ( le ) AND INTERLAMELLAR ( in ) DIRECTED MEDIALLY, bARbED, LENgTH AbOUT 1/2 THEIR MUTUAL DISTANCE ; ro WITH ~22µM; le AND in Of SIMILAR LENgTHS, ~64µM. SENSILLUS ( ss ) THICK , SHARP – TIPPED , WITH SERIES Of DISTINCT bARbS OCCUPYINg ALMOST ITS ENTIRE EXPOSED LENgTH, ~110µM ( FIgS. 15A–G , 16A, E , 17A, B , 19C ).

Notogaster. OUTLINE CIRCULAR TO PENTAgONAL IN DORSAL VIEW. POSTEROLATERAL MARgIN Of NOTOgASTER fLATTENED, VERTICAL bETWEEN SHARP ANgULAR bEND AND VENTRAL EDgE ( FIg. 16B ). WITH INCONSPICUOUS LONgITUDINAL DEPRESSIONS: UNPAIRED CENTRAL ONE IN ANTERIOR HALf AND PAIRED DEPRESSIONS IN POSTERIOR REgION jUST MEDIAL TO SETAE h 1 AND p 1 , WITH APPARENT LOW MOUND bETWEEN THEM ( FIg. 16D ). CUTICLE MOSTLY WITH VERY SHORT CRESTS, APPEARINg ALMOST SPINE–LIKE; POSTEROLATERALLY WITH LONgER CRESTS, RADIALLY ORIENTED. PTEROMORPH COVERED WITH LONg STRAIgHT CRESTS, RADIALLY ORIENTED, WITH SOME SHORT CRESTS AMONg THEM ( FIgS. 15A , 16A–E ). NOTOgASTRAL SETAE fLEXIbLE AND bARbED, MOST SIMILAR IN SIzE TO SETA in ; c 2 ~78µM; la , lm , lp , h 1 , h 2 AND h 3 ~63µM; p 1 , p 2 AND p 3 , ~25. LYRIfISSURE im ObSERVED IN DORSAL VIEW; ih , ip AND ips ObSERVED IN DORSOLATERAL VIEW; ia AND im LARgER THAN OTHERS, ih AND ips CLOSE TO EACH OTHER, IN THE LEVEL Of SETA p 3 ( FIg. 15A ). OPISTHONOTAL gLAND ( gla ) LOCATED bETWEEN LYRIfISSURES ih , im , ips , IN REgION Of SETAE p 3 AND h 3 . OCTOTAXIC SYSTEM INCOMPLETE, COMPRISINg TWO PAIRS Of SACCULES, Sa AND S2 ( FIgS. 15A , 16A–D ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Ventral region. COXISTERNUM IRREgULARLY TUbERCULATE; ANOgENITAL REgION WITH RAISED RIDgES fORMINg IRREgULAR NETWORK Of CELLS . EPIMERAL SETATION 2–0–1–2; SETAE 1b , 1c , 3b , 4a AND 4b RIgID, SMOOTH , ACUMINATE AND SHORT , ~8µM ( FIg. 15F ). CIRCUMPEDAL CARINAE ( cp ) SHARP ( FIg. 17C ). DISTANCE bETWEEN gENITAL AND ANAL APERTURES AbOUT EqUAL TO LENgTH Of gENITAL PLATE ( FIgS. 15F , 17C ). GENITAL PLATE COVERED WITH TUbERCULATED CEROTEgUMENT; APERTURE SUbqUADRATE, SLIgHTLY WIDER ANTERIORLY . GENITAL SETAE SIMILAR IN fORM TO EPIMERAL SETAE : g 1 AND g 2 ~11µM, INSERTED ON ANTERIOR MARgIN Of PLATE ; g 3 , g 4 , g 5 ALIgNED IN MIDDLE Of PLATE , g 6 SIMILAR , bUT ON POSTERIOR MARgIN Of PLATE , ~8µM ( FIgS. 15F , 17E ). AggENITAL SETA ( ag ) NEAR POSTEROLATERAL CORNER Of gENITAL PLATE , SIMILAR TO EPIMERAL SETAE IN SHAPE , ~8µM. ANAL APERTURE NEARLY PENTAgONAL, WIDER POSTERIORLY ; PLATES COVERED WITH TUbERCULATE CEROTEgUMENT; ANAL SETAE ( an 1 , an 2 ) SMOOTH , ACUMINATE , ~7µM; ADANAL SETAE ( ad 1 , ad 2 , ad 3 ) SMOOTH AND ACUMINATE , ~11µM. LYRIfISSURE iad PARALLEL TO LATERAL MARgIN Of ANAL PLATE ( FIg. 17F ).

Gnathosoma. SUbCAPITULUM COVERED WITH LONgITUDINAL CRESTS . TWO PAIRS Of or SETAE , ~ 9µM; SETA a AND m LONgER, ~14 AND 10µM RESPECTIVELY ; SETA h SHORTER, ~7µM ( FIgS. 15E , 17D ). CHELICERAE DENSELY POROSE bETWEEN LINE en AND bASE Of MOVAbLE DIgIT; SETAE cha AND C hb LONg AND bARbED, ~54 AND 35µM, RESPECTIVELY . TRägARDH'S ORgAN ( trg ) DIRECTED SLIgHTLY DORSAD, ~35µM ( FIg. 18D ).

Legs. TRIDACTYLOUS. NOT COVERED WITH CEROTEgUMENT; MOST ARTICLES SMOOTH, EXCEPT TROCHANTER III–IV AND fEMUR I–IV. PRETARSI WITH LATERAL CLAWS THINNER THAN EMPODIUM ( FIgS. 18A, C, E, F , 19D ). SETAL fORMULAE (LEgS I–IV): TROCHANTER 1–1–1–1, fEMUR 4–4–2–2, gENU 3–3–1–2, TIbIA 4–4–3–3 AND TARSUS 20–15–15–12 ( TAbLE 1 ). LEg I fAMULUS ( ε ) SHORT, ~6µM, WITH EXPANDED TIP, INSERTED POSTERIOR TO SOLENIDION ω 1 ( FIg. 18G ). LYRIfISSURE ly AT bASE Of TARSUS, NEAR ARTHRODIAL MEMbRANE SLIgHTLY TO ANTIAXIAL SIDE. SOLENIDIA NUMbER, fORM AND DISTRIbUTION AS SHOWN IN TAbLE 1 .

Material Examined. THE HOLOTYPE fEMALE AND 39 PARATYPES (4 MOUNTED IN SLIDES ENTIRE AND 15 DISSECTED, 20 MOUNTED ON A STUb fOR SEM) WERE COLLECTED
ON 10
–I–2008
AND 13
–VIII–2013 bY ANIbAL R. OLIVEIRA fROM SOIL –LITTER INTERfACE SAMPLES IN A CACAO PLANTATION AT UESC , ILHÉUS , BAHIA , BRAzIL
,
14°47'49"S , 39°10'23"W . THE HOLOTYPE AND 25 PARATYPES ARE DEPOSITED IN THE ACAROLOgICAL COLLECTION AT UESC , 7 PARATYPES ARE DEPOSITED IN THE ACAROLOgICAL COLLECTION AT THE ESCOLA SUPERIOR DE AgRICULTURA “LUIz DE QUEIROz” ( ESALQ ), UNIVERSIDADE DE SãO PAULO ( USP ), PIRACICAbA, SãO PAULO , BRAzIL
,
AND 7
PARATYPES ARE DEPOSITED IN THE ACAROLOgICAL COLLECTION AT DEPARTAMENTO DE ZOOLOgIA E BOTâNICA, UNIVERSIDADE ESTADUAL PAULISTA ( UNESP ), DZSJRP, SãO JOSÉ DO RIO PRETO , SãO PAULO , BRAzIL
